org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode

Class INodesInPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.INodesInPath

  • public class INodesInPath
extends Object
    Contains INodes information resolved from a given path.

    • Field Detail

      • LOG

        public static final org.apache.commons.logging.Log LOG

      • path

        private final byte[][] path

      • inodes

        private final INode[] inodes
        Array with the specified number of INodes resolved for a given path.

      • isSnapshot

        private final boolean isSnapshot
        true if this path corresponds to a snapshot

      • snapshotId

        private final int snapshotId
        For snapshot paths, it is the id of the snapshot; or Snapshot.CURRENT_STATE_ID if the snapshot does not exist. For non-snapshot paths, it is the id of the latest snapshot found in the path; or Snapshot.CURRENT_STATE_ID if no snapshot is found.

      • resolve

        static INodesInPath resolve(INodeDirectory startingDir,
                   byte[][] components,
                   boolean resolveLink)
                     throws org.apache.hadoop.fs.UnresolvedLinkException
        Retrieve existing INodes from a path. For non-snapshot path, the number of INodes is equal to the number of path components. For snapshot path (e.g., /foo/.snapshot/s1/bar), the number of INodes is (number_of_path_components - 1). An UnresolvedPathException is always thrown when an intermediate path component refers to a symbolic link. If the final path component refers to a symbolic link then an UnresolvedPathException is only thrown if resolveLink is true.

        Example:
        Given the path /c1/c2/c3 where only /c1/c2 exists, resulting in the following path components: ["","c1","c2","c3"]

        getExistingPathINodes(["","c1","c2"]) should fill the array with [rootINode,c1,c2],
        getExistingPathINodes(["","c1","c2","c3"]) should fill the array with [rootINode,c1,c2,null]

        Parameters:
        startingDir - the starting directory
        components - array of path component name
        resolveLink - indicates whether UnresolvedLinkException should be thrown when the path refers to a symbolic link.
        Returns:
        the specified number of existing INodes in the path
        Throws:
        org.apache.hadoop.fs.UnresolvedLinkException

      • shouldUpdateLatestId

        private static boolean shouldUpdateLatestId(int sid,
                           int snapshotId)

      • replace

        public static INodesInPath replace(INodesInPath iip,
                   int pos,
                   INode inode)
        Replace an inode of the given INodesInPath in the given position. We do a deep copy of the INode array.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the replacement
        inode - the new inode
        Returns:
        a new INodesInPath instance

      • append

        public static INodesInPath append(INodesInPath iip,
                  INode child,
                  byte[] childName)
        Extend a given INodesInPath with a child INode. The child INode will be appended to the end of the new INodesInPath.

      • getLatestSnapshotId

        public int getLatestSnapshotId()
        For non-snapshot paths, return the latest snapshot id found in the path.

      • getPathSnapshotId

        public int getPathSnapshotId()
        For snapshot paths, return the id of the snapshot specified in the path. For non-snapshot paths, return Snapshot.CURRENT_STATE_ID.

      • getINode

        public INode getINode(int i)
        Returns:
        the i-th inode if i >= 0; otherwise, i < 0, return the (length + i)-th inode.

      • getLastINode

        the last inode.

      • getAncestorINodesInPath

        private INodesInPath getAncestorINodesInPath(int length)
        Parameters:
        length - number of ancestral INodes in the returned INodesInPath instance
        Returns:
        the INodesInPath instance containing ancestral INodes. Note that this method only handles non-snapshot paths.

      • getParentINodesInPath

        public INodesInPath getParentINodesInPath()
        Returns:
        an INodesInPath instance containing all the INodes in the parent path. We do a deep copy here.

      • getExistingINodes

        public INodesInPath getExistingINodes()
        Returns:
        a new INodesInPath instance that only contains exisitng INodes. Note that this method only handles non-snapshot paths.

      • isSnapshot

        boolean isSnapshot()
        Returns:
        isSnapshot true for a snapshot path
